subject: Travel
title: Manichaeism: The Lost Religion
description: One-minute skill: Manichaeism: The Lost Religion.

hook.text: In the 3rd century, a Persian prophet named Mani created a religion that rivaled Christianity.

buildup.text: Manichaeism blended elements of Christianity, Buddhism, and Zoroastrianism into one faith.

discovery.text: It spread rapidly along the Silk Road, gaining followers from Rome to China.

twist.text: Both Christian and Islamic empires persecuted it. Mani himself was executed by the Persian king.

climax.text: The Uighur Empire made it their state religion in 762 AD, its last major stronghold.

punchline.text: A world religion vanished so completely most people never heard of it.
